turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Quickly, quickly -- talk very quickly what are you doing here with Anna Scott?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Anna Scott?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: The movie star?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Oh God.  Oh God.  Oh Goddy God.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: No.  Not true...

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: C'est la vie... We're lucky in lots of ways, but... Surely it's worth a brownie.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I just want to say to Tony -- don't take it personally.  The more I think about things, the more I see no rhyme or reason in life -- no one knows why some things work out, and some things don't -- why some of us get lucky -- and some of us...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: ... get fired.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Yes, they're shifting the whole outfit much more towards the trading side -- and of course...  I was total crap.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Hiya -- sorry -- the guinea fowl is proving more complicated than expected.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: He's cooking guinea fowl?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Don't even ask.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bella -- this is Anna.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Still loves you though.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: In a depressingly asexual way.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I never fancied you much actually...

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I mean I loved you -- you were terribly funny.  But all that kissing my ears...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh no -- this is just getting worse. I am going to find myself, 30 years from now, still on this couch.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Do you want to stay?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Why not -- all that awaits me at home is a masturbating Welshman.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Good decision.  All actresses are mad as snakes.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Tony -- what do you think?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: This painting isn't the original, is it?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes, I think that one may be.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Well, obviously it's me, isn't it -- I work in the City in a job I don't understand and everyone keeps getting promoted above me.  I haven't had a girlfriends since... puberty and, well, the long and short of it is, nobody fancies me, and if these cheeks get any chubbier, they never will.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: But she said she wanted to go out with you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- sort of...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: That's nice.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Well, you know, anybody saying they want to go out with you is... pretty great... isn't it...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It was sort of sweet actually -- I mean, I know she's an actress and all that, so she can deliver a line -- but she said that she might be as famous as can be -- but also... that she was just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Bloody hell, this is fun.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Is Miss Scott staying here?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hello, Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I'm sorry I'm so late.  Bollocksed up at work again, I fear.  Millions down the drain.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bernie -- this is Anna.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hello, Anna.  Delighted to meet you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Having you here, Anna, firmly establishes what I've long suspected, that we really are the most desperate hot of under-achievers.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Shame!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm not saying it's a bad thing, in fact, I think it's something we should take pride in.  I'm going to give the last brownie as a prize to the saddest act here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If anyone gets in our way -- we have small nuclear devices.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: And we intend to use them!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Where's Bella?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Is this your first film?

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: No -- it's my 22nd.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Of course it is.  Any favourite among the 22?

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Working with Leonardo.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Da Vinci?

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Di Caprio.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Of course.  And is he your favourite Italian film director?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: By the way -- it's you.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Yes.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Well, yes.  Groovy.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I was called and I came.  What's up?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: William has just turned down Anna Scott.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: You daft prick!

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: It was good.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Hi guys.  Oh holy fuck.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hun -- this is Anna.  Anna -- this is Honey -- she's my baby sitter.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Have we got something for you. Something which will make you love me so much you'll want to hug me every single day for the rest of my life.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Blimey.  What's that?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: The phone number of Anna Scott's agent in London and her agent in New York. You can ring her.  You think about her all the time -- now you can ring her!

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, thanks, that's great.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: It is great, isn't it.  See you tonight. Hey, Marty-- sexy cardy.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What do you think?  Good move?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Good move: when all is said and done, she's nothing special.  I saw her taking her pants off and I definitely glimpsed some cellulite down there.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ahm... room service.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: How you doing?  I thought you guys all wore those penguin coats.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, yes -- usually -- I'd just changed to go home -- but I thought I'd just deal with this final call.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Oh great.  Could you do me a favour and try to get us some really cold water up here?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Still, not sparkling.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Absolutely.  Ice cold still water.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Unless it's illegal in the UK to serve liquids below room temperature: I don't want you going to jail just to satisfy my whims...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, I'm sure it'll be fine.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: And maybe you could just adios the dishes and empty the trash.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ah -- no.  It's fine.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ahm... Bernie.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't get down what magazines you're from.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: 'Horse and Hound.'  The name's William Whacker.  I think she might be expecting me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Okay -- take a seat.  I'll check.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If you'd like to come with me we can rush you through the others.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: The others?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Mr. Thacker's from 'Horse and Hound.'

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Mr. Thacker?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Have you got a moment?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Are you a fan of Henry James?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: This is Henry James film?

turns.speaker: MALE LEAD
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.  Did you like the film?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ah... yes, enormously.

turns.speaker: MALE LEAD
turns.text: Well, fire away.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right, right.  Ahm -- did you enjoy making the film?

turns.speaker: MALE LEAD
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Any bit in particular?

turns.speaker: MALE LEAD
turns.text: Well, you tell me which bit you liked most -- and I'll tell you if I enjoyed making it.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ahm right, right, I liked the bit in space very much.  Did you enjoy making 	that bit?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Classic.  Absolutely classic. Profit from major sales push -- minus ?347.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Shall I go get a cappuccino?  Ease the pain.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes, better get me a half.  All I can afford.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Cappuccino as ordered.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Thanks.  I don't think you'll believe who was just in here.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Who?  Someone famous?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Would be exciting if someone famous did come into the shop though, wouldn't it?  Do you know -- this is pretty incredible actually -- I once saw Ringo Starr.  Or at least I think it was Ringo.  It might have been that broke from 'Fiddler On The Roof,' Toppy.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Topol.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: That's right -- Topol.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: But Ringo Starr doesn't look anything like Topol.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No, well... he was quite a long way away.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: So it could have been neither of them?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I suppose so.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  It's not a classic anecdotes, is it?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Not classic, no.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right -- want another one?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yes.  No, wait -- let's go crazy -- I'll have an orange juice.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Martin -- your customer.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I have to disturb you when you're cooking the books, but there's a delivery.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Martin, can't you just deal with this yourself?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But it's not for the shop.  It's for you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Okay.  Tell me, would I have to pay a wet rag as much as I pay you?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Excuse me -- it's your mother on the phone.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Can you tell her I'll ring her back.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I actually tried that tack -- but she said you said that before and it's been twenty-four hours, and her foot that was purple is now a sort of blackish color...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Okay -- perfect timing as ever -- hold the fort for a second will you, Martin?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Max.  This is Anna.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hello, Anna ahm...  Scott -- have some wine.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You haven't slept with her, have you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That is a cheap question and the answer is, of course, no comment.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: 'No comment' means 'yes.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, it doesn't.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Do you ever masturbate?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Definitely no comment.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You see -- it means 'yes.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: So I get the brownie?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think you do, yes.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You didn't know she had a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No -- did you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bloody hell, I can't believe it -- my whole life ruined because I don't read 'Hello' magazine.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Let's face facts.  This was always a no-go situation.  Anna's a goddess and you know what happens to mortals who get involved with the gods.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Buggered?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Every time.  But don't despair -- I think I have the solution to your problems.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: She's perfect, perfect.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I think you have forgotten...  what an unusual situation you have here -- to find someone you actually love, who'll love you -- the chances are... always miniscule.  Look at me -- not counting the American -- I've only loved two girls in my whole life, both total disasters.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's not fair.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No really, one of them marries me and then leaves me quicker than you can say Indiana Jones -- and the other, who seriously ought to have known better, casually marries my best friend.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Wait a minute -- I'm your brother and I don't know anything about this.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is it someone we know?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Any more announcements?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- I feel I must apologize to everyone for my behavior for the last six months.  I have, as you know, been slightly down in the mouth.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: There's an understatement.  There are dead people on better form.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: But I wish to make it clear I've turned a corner and henceforward intend to be impressively happy.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So -- you've laid the ghost.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I believe I have.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't give a damn about the famous girl.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, don't think I do.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Which means you won't be distracted by the fact that she's back in London, grasping her Oscar, and to be found filming most days on Hampstead Heath.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh God no.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So not over her, in fact.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Absolutely.  Never trust a vegetarian.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Great.  Excellent.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: May I help you, sir?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ahm, look this is a very odd situation.  I'm a friend of Anna Scott's -- and she rang me at home the day before yesterday -- and left a message saying she's staying with you...

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry, we don't have anyone of that name here, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, that's right -- I know that.  She said she's using another name -- but the problem is she left the message with my flatmate, which was a serious mistake.

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I have him in my mind.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: And then double it -- and that is the -- what can I say -- git I'm living with and he cannot remember...

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: How about Miss Flintstone?

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Or Bambi... or, I don't know, Beavis or Butthead?

turns.speaker: RITZ MAN
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  Right.  Fair enough.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: SECURITY
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- I was looking for Anna Scott...

turns.speaker: SECURITY
turns.text: Does she know you're coming?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, no.  She doesn't.

turns.speaker: SECURITY
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't really let you through then, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh right.  I mean, I am a friend -- I'm not a lunatic but -- no, you basically...

turns.speaker: SECURITY
turns.text: ... can't let you through.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Even he.  Hey, you couldn't help me with an incredibly important decision, could you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: This is important in comparison to, let's say, whether they should cancel third world debt?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: That's right -- I'm at last going out on a date with the great Janine and I just want to be sure I've picked the right t-shirt.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What are the choices?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Well... wait for it...  First there's this one...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- might make it hard to strike a really romantic note.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Point taken.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Cool, huh?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- she might think you don't have true love on your mind.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Wouldn't want that...  Okay -- just one more.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, yes, that's perfect. Well done.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Thanks.  Great.  Wish me luck.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: There's something wrong with this yogurt.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It's not yogurt -- it's mayonnaise.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Well, there you go.  On for a video fest tonight?  I've got some absolute classic.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Imagine -- somewhere in the world there's a man who's allowed to kiss her.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes, she is fairly fabulous.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Just incidentally -- why are you wearing that?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Ahm -- combination of factors really. No clean clothes...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: There never will be, you know, unless you actually clean your clothes.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Right.  Vicious circle.  And then I was like rooting around in your things, and found this, and I thought -- cool. Kind of spacey.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: There's something wrong with the goggles though...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, they were prescription, so I could see all the fishes properly.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Groovy.  You should do more of this stuff.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: So -- any messages?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Yeh, I wrote a couple down.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Two?  That's it?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: You want me to write down all your messages?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Who were the ones you didn't write down from?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Ahm let's see -- ahm.  No.  Gone completely.  Oh no, wait.  There was -- one from your mum: she said don't forget lunch and her leg's hurting again.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  No one else?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What did she say?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Well, it was genuinely bizarre... she said, hi -- it's Anna -- and then she said, call me at the Ritz -- and then gave herself a completely different name.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Which was?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Absolutely no idea.  Remembering one name's bad enough...

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Try 'Flintstone.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I think she said her name was 'Flintstone.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Does 'Flintstone' mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bollocks, bollocks, bollocks.  Have you seen my glasses?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: No, 'fraid not.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bollocks.  This happens every time I go to the cinema.  Average day, my glasses are everywhere -- everywhere I look, glasses.  But the moment I need them they disappear.  It's one of life's real cruelties.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: That's compared to, like, earthquakes in the Far East or testicular cancer?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh shit, is that the time?  I have to go.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Thanks for your help on the glasses thing.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: You're welcome.  Did you find them?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, okay.  There's this girl...

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Aha!  I'd been getting a female vibe. Good.  Speak on, dear friend.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: She's someone I just can't -- someone who... self-evidently can't be mine -- and it's as if I've taken love-heroin -- and now I can't even have it again. I've opened Pandora's box.  And there's trouble inside.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't mention that Anna's a vegetarian, did I?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I have some parsnip stew from last week. If I just peel the skin off, it'll be perfect.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh my God...  Hello.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Hello.  I wonder if I could have a little word.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Spike.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I don't want to interfere, or anything ... but she's split up from her boy- friend, that's right isn't it?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: And she's in your house.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: And you get on very well.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Well, isn't this perhaps a good opportunity to... slip her one?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Spike.  For God's sake -- she's in trouble -- get a grip.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Right.  Right.  You think it's the wrong moment.  Fair enough.  Do you mind if I have a go?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Spike!

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: No -- you're right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'll talk to you in the morning.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Okay -- okay.  Might be too late, but okay.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I wouldn't go outside.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Just take my work for it.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I went out in my goddamn underwear too.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Get out, Spike.  I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: What he's going to say next is -- there are people starving in the Sudan.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, there are.  And we don't need to go anywhere near that far.  My best friend slipped -- she slipped down- stairs, cracked her back and she's in a wheelchair for the rest of her life. All I'm asking for is a normal amount of perspective.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Was it you?

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: I suppose I might have told one or two people down the pub.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm going to throw out these old videos.

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: No.  You can't bin these.  They're classics.  I'm not allowing this.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right -- let's talk about rent...

turns.speaker: SPIKE
turns.text: Let me help.  We don't want all this shit cluttering up our lives.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Which floor?

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Are you sure you...?

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh.  Right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No -- they're... for my grandmother. She's in a hospital nearby.  Thought I'd kill two birds with one stone.

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Which hospital?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Do you mind me not saying -- it's a rather distressing disease and the name of the hospital rather gives it away.

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: Oh sure.  Of course.

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: How was she?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Fabulous.

turns.speaker: TARQUIN
turns.text: Wait a minute -- she took your grandmother's flowers?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Bad news.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: We've got a security camera in this bit of the shop.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: So, I saw you put that book down your trousers.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: What book?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: The one down your trousers.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: I haven't got a book down my trousers.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right -- well, then we have something of an impasse.  I tell you what -- I'll call the police -- and,	what can I say? -- If I'm wrong about the whole book-down-the-trousers scenario, I really apologize.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Okay -- what if I did have a book down my trousers?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, ideally, when I went back to the desk, you'd remove the Cadogan guide to Bali from your trousers, and either wipe it and put it back, or buy it.  See you in a sec.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: At the close of Friday's meeting, we were discussing Mister Harding's problem, concerning his wife...  Mister Harding stated that his wife made him uneasy because she drew stares from men on the street. Is that correct, Mister Harding?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Yes, that's perfectly correct.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: He also thinks he may have given her reason to seek sexual attention elsewhere, but he didn't say how. He has been heard to say to his wife, 'I hate you, I don't ever want to see you again. You've betrayed me.'  So. Does anyone care to touch upon this further?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Am I to take it that there isn't a man among you who has an opinion concerning this matter?  Mister Harding, you've stated on more than one occasion that you suspected your wife of seeing other men.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Yes, Miss Ratched, this is correct.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: But you have no proof.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: No, Miss Ratched...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: And yet you suspect her.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Yes, that is correct.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: I can only speculate as to the reasons why.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Have you ever speculated, Mister Harding, that you are impatient with your wife because she does not meet your mental requirements?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: No secrets, Mister Harding. Let's get it all out in the open...

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: I mean, the other day you made an allusion to my wife and the possible sexual problems we might be having. I know that to be the case, but the way in which you broached it, if that's your idea of teaching me something...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes, Mister Harding?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Yes, thank you, Miss Ratched. Since our last meeting I have been reflecting, quite seriously, on the nature of my problem. Naturally, I'm referring to the capacity to obtain the necessary results in order to obtain... No, no. To personify the very existence of that relationship regardless of the function...  Regardless of the function, we will confront the question of... Yes. Yes. The question of... Existence... Relationship... Function... Confront... Yes, confronting us in the moment of deepest crisis... Yes, the crisis of our souls. Of our souls, which I am trying to fully understand the problem... the problem. Not to shut ourselves off, but somehow... Somehow to understand fully our capacity... to obtain... to personify... the question... existence depends... depends on the question... to reflect... to reflect...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes, Mister Harding?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Is it true McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped yesterday?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: No. Mister Harding, that is not true.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: M-m-m-ma'am?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Would you like to start?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: N-n-n-n-n-no, ma'am.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister Sefelt?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes, Billy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I-I-I-I-I d-d-don't s-s-see how anyone could lu-lu-lu-love a man who t-t-t-talks the way he does.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Was it your idea to visit her on Sunday?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Y-y-y-yes...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Tell us about it...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I-I-I-I c-c-c-came over S-S-S Sunday m-m-m-morning after ch-ch-ch church and br-br-brought her s-s some flowers, and I s-s-said, I said, 'C-C-C-Celia, will you muh muh-muh-muh-muh...' till the girl broke out l-l-laughing.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: What was it about her that disturbed you so, Billy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I was in luh-love with her.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Billy, were you afraid of her, or of her love?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: You mean you don't want their votes to count, Billy!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: P-p-p-please du-du-du-don't t-t tell her, p-p-please...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: You should have thought about that before you brought that woman in here!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: N-n-n-n-no, no, I du-du-du-didn't, I didn't!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: I don't want your mother to believe something like this but what am I to think?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sh-sh-sh-she m-m-made m-m-me do it!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Billy, that girl couldn't have pulled you in there forcibly...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sh-sh-she did! Everybody did!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Who? Tell me!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: M-M-Muh-Muh-McMurphy!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Get up, Billy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No! No! No!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: N-n-n-n-duh-duh-duh-pl-pl-pl-pl-muh muh-muh...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister Washington.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Easy now, don't smudge 'em, we got lots of games ahead of us...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yes, ma'am...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Will you come with me, please.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hold the fort down, will ya, fellas!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: My name is Miss Ratched. I'm the head nurse here. You've already met Miss Pilbow and Aides Washington and Warren.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.
